instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message:
This board is not liquide damage. I found short smc that I replaced and now I have green light and ppbus at 12.54V
3V estables but 5V pulsing each 6 seg. CPU core pulsing too. Could be bad donor-SMC or something else?

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message:
Check all S0 lines for a short to ground.

With short SMC I assume you meant <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>? Is the voltage of this stable?

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: Yes, 3V42 was shorted because of SMC. After replaced, this rail is stable.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: So how are the S0 lines doing, no shorts?

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: Great to know what board this is. Also great to know the history, SMC does not "just" short.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Customer says that one day it just dont power anymore. No short on coils.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: I replaced the SMC again and same thing. Pulsing each 6 seg.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: Could be anything and the customer is lying. CPU Vcore also pulsing?

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: Cpu vcore also pulsing. Now told me that fan run fast last time and opened the laptop to replace the cpu compound and clean the fan.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: So it could be anything. Check for knocked off components.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message:
History:
Other guy replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> but he burnt both mosfets someway. So, I think in some time ppbus recived 20V directly from ac adapter if upper mosfet was burnt firstly.
Can that burn some component on ppbus?

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: Now it can be anything and everything. Rabbit hole.....avoid.

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message:
Ok, told me he power the board without <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
This damaged both mosfets, low and upper. But this can damage more things?

threads.title: Short SMC
threads.message: I really have no idea, this was just fucked with and everything could be wrong.
